lead_paragraph: COOPERSMITH--Jack, of Boca Raton, died on January 10, 2016, at the age of 94. He is survived by his wife of 71 years, Anita Selikoff Coopersmith, his son Jeffrey (Marjie), daughters Leslie (Michael) Greenberg, Amy (Stan) Baratz, grandchildren, Lorie (John) FitzGibbon, Julie Myers, Jarred (Bernadine) Coopersmith, Aubrey (David) Lipscomb, Blake (Sara) Baratz, Justin (Rachel) Baratz, Courtney Baratz (fiancee Ryan Rosoff), great-grandchildren Bexley Baratz, Harlow Baratz, Hannah Lipscomb, Sophie Lipscomb, Lily FitzGibbon and Jane FitzGibbon. Jack thought of himself as one of the luckiest men in the world, with an adoring wife and family who loved him and whom he loved dearly; parents and in-laws who he respected and loved, and a career he enjoyed. He lived the American dream. Jack served in the US Army during World War II, landing in Normandy on D+3. After the war he was a founding partner of Tricap Realty, ultimately joining Leonard Litwin at Glenwood Management. He retired in 1992 as Senior Vice President responsible for all leasing operations. He was a founding member of Temple Avodah, Oceanside, NY. Jack was a man with style, a big heart, engaging charm and a wicked wit. He loved to dance with his wife to Frank Sinatra and big band tunes. He loved playing golf with his many friends at the Boca Woods Country Club. The family requests that memorial donations be made to the Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation at: JDRF, 3001 Metro Drive Suite 100, Bloomington, MN 55425, 952-851-0770. 1/3
